fields.description:
Currently the SC creates a file in the var/lib/eucalyptus/Volumes directory, mounts it as a loopback device, creates the physical volume, logical volume, and volume group in lvm and exports the target via tgt upon volume creation rather than attachment.

At creation, only the file should be created. At attachment the file should be exported via lvm + tgt. At detach the loopback, lvm state, and tgt state should be cleaned.

This would allow the SC to shut down properly as long as all volumes are detached from instances cleanly.
fields.summary: SC with TGT should only use loopbacks when volume is attached

comments.body: This issue has caused shutdown issues for the SC in customer installations
I don't remember if the CLC needs the IQN and stores it. I know the CLC now sends an attach to the SC, so a bunch of things can be done then.
The CLC sends the IQN of the NC to the SC, but does not store the IQN of the volume itself, just passes it along to the CC->NC in the remote device string.

commit b07e2de1d54c8a98efcc1112a677420aebcf5ae8
Author: Neil Soman <neil@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Mon Oct 1 17:20:02 2012 -0700

    SC with TGT should only use loopbacks when volume is attached
    
    Changed OverlayManager so that tgt export only happens when a volume is attached.
    
    Snapshot and detach now tear down loop devices.
    
    EUCA-3325

To test: When all volumes have been detached and all snapshots are completed, the following commands on the SC should return no output.

tgtadm --op show --mode target

lvdisplay

losetup -a

When all volumes have been detached and all snapshots are completed, lvdisplay and losetup -a show connections in the output.

{code}


    [root@eucahost-51-159 ~]# euca-describe-instances
    [root@eucahost-51-159 ~]# euca-describe-volumes
    [root@eucahost-51-159 ~]# euca-describe-snapshots

    SNAPSHOT snap-7D043CFA vol-C8343B4F completed 2012-10-31T22:30:02.331Z 100% 013477233856 5 None
    [root@eucahost-51-159 ~]# tgtadm --op show --mode target
    [root@eucahost-51-159 ~]# lvdisplay

    LV Path /dev/vg-BeL4nA../lv-zMKMqQ..

    [root@eucahost-51-159 ~]# losetup -a
    /dev/loop2: [0803]:1311552 (/disk1/storage/eucalyptus/instances/volumes/vol-C8343B4F)

{code}
This should have been resolved. Please retry and report back. Thanks.

This fix should be entirely in github. Look for EUCA-3325 in the log comment. There have been several small fixes after the main fix to get some bugs out, but you can simply look at the current storage controller code to see how it is implemented.

Specifically, we create the volume, setup a loopback, construct LVM state, and then disable the LVM volumes/groups and free the loopback on completion of volume-create.  On attach a loopback is found and used and the LVM state re-enabled and then the tgt export is done.

Thus, only when a volume is attached will the loopback be used. For volumes that are extant but not attached the only artifacts on the system will be disabled lvm vg,lv and a file on the filesystem.

Detach is not a bit strange because we have to wait until the NC has disconnected the target before we can tear down the tgt lun and target, but once detach completes the loopback is freed and the lvm vg & lv are disabled again. Doing a snapshot requires the lvm lv to be enabled so a loopback is used during a snapshot but freed again if source volume is not also attached to a client/exported.
Thanks for the feedback.  Really appreciate it.
This was fixed previously, just now updating this ticket.
